message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with image processing and computer vision applications such as closed contour detection, perceptual grouping, and tubular structure extraction. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves numerical optimization and partial differential equations, which could fall under cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) or cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The use of steerable filters for image data-driven speed functions could also place the paper under cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper involves geometric concepts such as curvature and minimal paths, which could fall under cs.GR (Graphics).
